content:
Course Code                                                               Unnamed: 0
          Course Title                                                                  Project
                Credit                                                                       20
     Teaching per Week                                 20 hours (i.e. 2 Students / hour / Week)
     Minimum weeks per         15 (Project work, Self-Study, examination, preparation, holidays
              Semester                                                                    etc.)
Last Review / Revision                                                                      ---
     Purpose of Course      Students will get trained in industrial practices and activities of
                   NaN                                                     Software Engineering
      Course Objective    To expose students to industrial practices and activities of software
                   NaN                               engineering and train them about the same.
          Prerequisite               Knowledge of Advanced Programming, Latest Technologies and
                   NaN                                          Tools and Software Engineering.
       Course Out come    After completion of this course, the student will be capable to start
                   NaN         professional career and/or research work in the field of Web and
                   NaN                                                       Mobile Technology.
        Course Content       Entire semester is allocated for a full-time project work. All the
                   NaN      students have to undergo a project preferably in an industry or any
                   NaN        reputed institute. The students must prepare documentation of the
                   NaN     project work done as per the software Engineering Guidelines. At the
                   NaN end of the semester, the students have to submit their project report in
                   NaN     bounded form to the respective institution. The project presentation
                   NaN                   and viva – voice will be conducted on the basis of it.
                   NaN    The students have to submit the following reports to their respective
                   NaN                                                             institution:
                   NaN                                                1. Project Joining Report
                   NaN                                       2. Appropriate name of the project
                   NaN             3. Monthly Progress Report duly sign by the concern external
                   NaN                                                                    guide
                   NaN                                        4. Project Completion Certificate
                   NaN                                       5. Institution/College Certificate
                   NaN       6. Software Coding declaration...(if industry/organization doesn‟t
                   NaN      permit students to submit the source code) ( To be submitted at the
                   NaN                                        time of joining project training)
                   NaN                                                     7. Attendance Report
                   NaN    Without such reports student will not be allowed to appear in his/her
                   NaN                               final Project Presentation and Viva-Voice.
  Teaching Methodology                                                 Project guidance, review
     Evaluation Method          70% Internal assessment is based on project presentation and/or
                   NaN                                demonstration and viva-voice examination.
                   NaN        30% assessment is based Project Presentation and/or demonstration
                   NaN                       and viva-voice examination at the end of semester.

Course Code                                                           Unnamed: 0
          Course Title              Seminar Presentation/Review of published research paper
                Credit                                                                    4
     Teaching per Week                             10 hours (i.e. 2 Students / hour / Week)
     Minimum weeks per     15 (Project work, Self-Study, examination, preparation, holidays
              Semester                                                                etc.)
Last Review / Revision                                                                  ---
     Purpose of Course      The purpose of the course is to make student capable of gaining
                   NaN         additional knowledge (besides the curricula) in the field of
                   NaN     information technology by self-learning practices and presenting
                   NaN                                             and/or demonstrating it.
                   NaN                                                                   OR
                   NaN         The purpose of a review paper is to succinctly review recent
                   NaN    progress in a particular topic. Overall, the paper summarizes the
                   NaN current state of knowledge of the topic. It creates an understanding
                   NaN  of the topic for the reader by discussing the findings presented in
                   NaN                                               recent research papers
      Course Objective            Additional knowledge building in the field of Information
                   NaN           Technology using self-learning practice and research paper
                   NaN                                                             reviews.
          Prerequisite                  Basic Knowledge of Information Technology theories,
                   NaN                              activities, methods, techniques & tools
       Course Out come        After completion of this course, the student will have gained
                   NaN            further knowledge (besides the curricula) in the field of
                   NaN        information technology by self-learning practices and will be
                   NaN                    capable of presenting and/or demonstrating it. OR
                   NaN                 The student will benefit with research paper reviews
                   NaN                         To help improve writing and research skills
                   NaN                         To professionalize the graduate experience.
                   NaN                                      To inform a future career path
        Course Content      In this paper students will have to select any topic related to
                   NaN        information technology field– preferably based on the current
                   NaN       trends and technologies for the seminar. Individual student is
                   NaN     required to prepare a seminar report. At the end of the semester
                   NaN  student has to submit seminar report with satisfactory detail study
                   NaN       in the bounded form to the respective institution. The seminar
                   NaN        presentation and viva voice will be conducted on the basis of
                   NaN                           selected topic at the end of the semester.
                   NaN         The students have to submit the following documents to their
                   NaN                                              respective institution:
                   NaN                          1. Name and abstract of the Topic selected.
                   NaN       2. Monthly Progress Report duly signed by the concern internal
                   NaN                                                                guide
                   NaN                     3. Work Completion Certificate by internal guide

Unnamed: 0                               4. Institution/College Certificate
Teaching Methodology                                         Seminar guidance, review
   Evaluation Method  70% Internal assessment is based on seminar presentation and/or
                 NaN                        demonstration and viva-voice examination.
                 NaN              30% assessment is based seminar Presentation and/or
                 NaN demonstration and viva-voice examination at the end of semester.
